title: Fix missing homepage hero image asset and rendering

requirements.text: Ensure the homepage Hero background image file exists in the deployed frontend static assets at the exact public path "/assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg" so it loads reliably after builds/deploys.

quotes: There is no picture on the front page

acceptanceCriteria: The file is present in the repo at frontend/public/assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg.
Loading the homepage triggers a successful (HTTP 200) request for /assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg (no 404/failed request in browser devtools).
The cruise ship image is visible as a full-viewport background in the Hero section on the homepage.

requirements.text: Update the Hero component (frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx) to handle image load failures in a user-visible way while preserving the intended full-screen background behavior (e.g., show the existing gradient fallback plus a small, readable message indicating the image failed to load).

quotes: There is no picture on the front page

acceptanceCriteria: If the hero image fails to load, the page shows the existing gradient fallback background and an English message indicating the hero image could not be loaded.
If the hero image loads successfully, it displays behind the overlay as a full-viewport background (object-cover) with no layout shift or disappearance on refresh/reload.

constraints: Do not change any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Keep the Hero image reference path exactly "/assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg" (as used in frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx).
Do not route the hero image through the backend; it must be a frontend public static asset.
nonGoals: Adding new homepage sections or changing the overall homepage content beyond what is needed to restore/confirm the hero image visibility.

required: Cruise ship hero photo at sea, wide landscape (cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg, 1600x900)
